document.docOrigin: Journal of Natural History (J. Nat. Hist.) 47 (5 - 12)
document.masterDocTitle: Diversity of freshwater copepods (Maxillopoda: Copepoda: Calanoida, Cyclopoida) from Chiapas, Mexico with a description of Mastigodiaptomus suarezmoralesi sp. nov.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Diversity of freshwater copepods (Maxillopoda: Copepoda: Calanoida, Cyclopoida) from Chiapas, Mexico with a description of Mastigodiaptomus suarezmoralesi sp. nov.

bibRefCitation.author: Mirabdullayev IM & Defaye D
bibRefCitation.refString: Mirabdullayev IM, Defaye D. 2004. On the taxonomy of the Acanthocyclops robustus speciescomplex (copepod, Cyclopidae): Acanthocyclops brevispinosus and A. einslei sp. n. Vestnik zoologii. 38: 27 - 37.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Four adult males and one female urosome from km 16 pond, San Cristóbal-Palenque highway, Chiapas , Mexico (
16 ◦ 42 ′ 59 ′′ N
,
92 ◦ 40 ′ 43 ′′ W
) collected
13 January 2001
, preserved in 70% ethanol with a drop of glycerine (ECO-CHZ-05524)
.

caption.paragraph:
Table 3. Comparison (based on published data) of nine species of
Mastigodiaptomus
.

paragraph.tableNote: ND, not determined; Fu, furcal rami; L / W, length / width ratio; L, length ratio.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This is a new record for Mexico ;
Acanthocyclops einslei
was recently described from biological material collected in Europe, Japan , USA and Canada ( Mirabdullayev and Defaye 2004 ) the species belongs to the
Acanthocyclops robustus
species-complex. All morphological characters, even the meristic features observed in the specimens from Chiapas, are similar to those of the original description, except the presence of denticules (arranged in arched rows) on ventral and dorsal surfaces of anal somite found in the Chiapas material.
